fields.title: 5 HTML tags you might not know!
fields.author: Saad Baig
fields.description: HTML is a powerful markup language which can be used to give our web applications structure...
fields.body:
HTML is a powerful markup language which can be used to give our web applications structure. Learn more about HTML5 [here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/Getting_started_with_the_web/HTML_basics "here")

In this article, I'll show you 5 rare HTML Tags that probably you have never heard of. While they might be less familiar to you but they're still quite useful and you can create more structurally-sound web applications with the help of them.

## 1- DATALIST
This tag specifies a list of predefined options for an INPUT element.

![Datalist tag](//images.ctfassets.net/awy0uwqcdbbl/33poSYqFEoc8oC6H9HxMI7/5813db3ff3d055965b51b79eaecd456d/EvuL0AfXYAEI--i.jpg)

## 2- TEMPLATE
Use this tag to hide some content when the page loads. It can be made visible later using JavaScript.

![template-tag](//images.ctfassets.net/awy0uwqcdbbl/5SegEAuLy3YJUPpeTCpnob/4c7099c72447df3fa898ffae39ee8b3a/EvuNJhlXEAIbi7r.jpg)

## 3- METER
This tag can be used to measure data within a given range. You can use this tag to display disk usage statistics.

![meter-tag-code](//images.ctfassets.net/awy0uwqcdbbl/1bDGG3dcu0CdPgz6YzMb05/c8b20d4fa217ca7848517aae86bf765c/meter.jpg)

## 4- TIME
This tag defines a specific or human-readable time. It helps search engines to produce smarter search results.

![time-tag-code](//images.ctfassets.net/awy0uwqcdbbl/6CdCSsL80yFjUMw0iNWF8S/26aec9716cad7475d13b8432561495c3/time.jpg)

## 5- OPTGROUP
This tag is a great way to add group related options in a SELECT element (drop-down list).

![optgroup-tag-code](//images.ctfassets.net/awy0uwqcdbbl/21bouzXSSNd4iY1NYRvkPY/a2df6360c8a3b370c5caea767df5ccac/optgroup.jpg)

fields.title: Master Web Development with Building Projects - The Top-Rated Learning Method
fields.author: Saad Baig
fields.description: Are you ready to take your web development skills to the next level? If so, Building Projects is the perfect learning method for you.
fields.body: ![Photo by Sean Pollock on Unsplash ](//images.ctfassets.net/awy0uwqcdbbl/3ORKgaEPnXp9fLZtDd9ch3/4a0c69c489bcc7b8ebd7278296f58ae8/sean-pollock-PhYq704ffdA-unsplash.jpg) Building Projects is a hands-on approach to learning web development that involves creating real-world projects from start to finish. This method is highly effective because it allows you to apply the concepts and techniques you learn in a practical, meaningful way. By building projects, you can see the results of your efforts and gain a deeper understanding of how web development works. Here are some of the reasons why I want you to start building projects today: ## Boost Confidence When you build projects and see them through to completion, It gives you a __boost__ in your confidence and give you a sense of achievement. It will help you to __level up__. It can also motivate you to continue learning and developing your skills. When you complete a project, you have the opportunity to see the results of your work and see how your skills and knowledge have translated into a real-world application. This can give you a sense of accomplishment and help you feel more confident in your abilities as a developer. ## Improves Problem-solving skills As web developers, Our job is to figure out complex problems and find creative solutions. By building projects, Your problem-solving skills can be improved and it can help you to think critically and creatively. It allows you to tackle challenges and overcome obstacles. As you work through problems and find solutions, you can develop your problem-solving skills and feel more confident in your ability to handle challenges as a developer. ## Increases the chances of getting hired One of the biggest benefits of building projects is that it gives you the chance to showcase your work and demonstrate your skills to potential clients or employers. By building a portfolio of projects that showcases your abilities, you can make yourself more attractive to potential employers or clients and increase your chances of getting hired or landing new projects. It makes you feel more prepared to tackle new challenges or projects. ## Mindset Building Projects is not just about learning technical skills. It's also about developing the mindset and habits of a successful web developer. By working through the challenges and problem-solving involved in building projects, you'll learn how to think critically, work collaboratively, and stay motivated and focused. ## Collaboration When you build projects, you get the chance to receive feedback from other developers, which can help you improve your skills and grow as a developer. It allows you to learn how to work in teams and collaborate with others, which is an essential skill in the field. When you collaborate with other developers, It exposes you to different viewpoints and approaches to problem-solving, which can help you expand your knowledge and perspective as a developer. So if want to master web development and set up your dream career, give building Projects a try. it's the top-rated learning method for aspiring web developers. I hope this article has convinced you of the value of building projects as a learning method for web development. Whether you're just starting out or looking to take your skills to the next level, Building Projects is a powerful way to learn, grow, and succeed in the world of web development.

fields.title: What is Conceptual clarity?
fields.author: Saad Baig
fields.description: Many of us lack "conceptual clarity" because instead of learning well, we are too focused on learning things fast.
fields.body:
Many of us lack "conceptual clarity" because instead of learning well, we are too focused on learning things fast.
## What is a concept?
A concept is a formed idea which is framed in such a way that it can be explained to "myself" and to others

My natural assumption is that my personal explanation of the idea is clear and since it is instinctively clear to me I may assume that it is already formed.

But what if someone comes along and ask, "Why?" I might be unable to answer that appropriately because I have not formed that idea to the point where I can explain the "Why" to myself.

Once I can explain the concept to myself, I have conceptual clarity and I am in a position to explain it to others in a way that makes sense.

fields.name: Ben Gurion Webapp Demo
fields.description:
## Introduction:
Ben Gurion Museum is a renowned museum located in Israel that displays the life and achievements of Israel's first prime minister, David Ben Gurion. 

The museum hosts various events and exhibitions throughout the year. To streamline the process of ticket purchasing and event management, a web application and an admin panel have been developed by me. The web application enables users to purchase tickets for events, while the admin panel empowers the museum staff to manage the events and orders more efficiently.

## Features:
The web application provides users with a user-friendly interface that facilitates easy ticket purchasing. It consists of the following features:

Event Listing: The events of the museum are listed on the home page, along with their details such as date, time, price and types of visitors.

Ticket Purchase: Users can purchase tickets for different types of people, such as old people, adults, and children, for each event by clicking on the "add visitor" button. The tickets can be added and removed from the cart as per the user's requirements.

Order Details: After adding tickets to the cart, users are required to enter their order details on the order details page.

Payment: Upon submitting the order details, users are asked to enter their payment information. After successful payment submission, the tickets are booked.

## Conclusion:

The Ben Gurion Museum web application and admin panel provide an efficient way to manage the events and orders. The web application simplifies the ticket purchasing process for users, while the admin panel empowers museum staff to manage the events and orders more efficiently. Together, they make the Ben Gurion Museum a better place for visitors to enjoy the exhibitions and events.

fields.name: Ben Gurion Admin Demo (Desktop)
fields.description:
The admin panel provides museum staff with a powerful set of tools to manage the events and orders efficiently. It consists of the following features:

- Login Page: The admin panel has a login page for admins to log in.

- Dashboard Screen: The dashboard screen provides admins with data about the museum's performance, including daily income, monthly visitors, and daily and monthly number of orders.

- Manage Content Screen: The manage content screen enables admins to manage the content of the web application.

- Event Detail Page: The event detail page enables admins to update the details of the events, including the hours of operation and the types of visitors allowed for each event.

- Create Constraints Screen: The create constraints screen allows admins to define constraints for an event, such as the maximum number of visitors allowed per hour.

- List of Constraints Screen: The list of constraints screen lists all the constraints defined for the events.

- Orders Screen: The orders screen displays a table of all the orders with their details, such as the date, time, name, payment status etc. Admins can filter the orders by date, time, and name and can search for specific orders. They can also archive orders that are no longer relevant.

- Closing Screen: The closing screen enables admins to close some days for events.

- Coupon Management Screen: The coupon management screen allows admins to manage the coupons for the events.

Conclusion:

The Ben Gurion Museum web application and admin panel provide an efficient way to manage the events and orders. The web application simplifies the ticket purchasing process for users, while the admin panel empowers museum staff to manage the events and orders more efficiently. Together, they make the Ben Gurion Museum a better place for visitors to enjoy the exhibitions and events.

fields.name: Get Part
fields.description:
## I. Introduction

This web application is for selling and buying vehicle parts. The main objective of the project was to provide a platform for users to easily buy and sell vehicle parts, whether they were looking for a specific part or the suppliers wanting to sell parts.

## II. Key challenges

One of the main challenges I faced while building this project was that it had to be made from right to left and the main language was Hebrew, which was a little difficult for me to adapt to as I am used to building from left to right. However, I was able to overcome this challenge by taking the time to familiarize myself with the right-to-left layout and making sure that all of the elements on the page were correctly aligned.

## III. Solutions implemented

To address the challenge of building the application from right to left, I took the following steps:

- I familiarized myself with the right-to-left layout by researching best practices and reviewing examples of other right-to-left websites.

- I made sure to align all of the elements on the page correctly, including text, images, and buttons.

- I tested the application on different devices and browsers to ensure that it was displaying correctly for all users.

## IV. Results

As a result of the solutions I implemented, the web application was successful in achieving its main objective of providing a platform for users to easily buy and sell vehicle parts. Some of the specific results we saw included:

- Increased user engagement: The number of users visiting the website and using the application increased significantly after its launch.

- Improved user experience: Feedback from users indicated that they found the application easy to use and navigate, thanks to the well-designed layout and intuitive interface.

- Increased website traffic: The website saw a significant increase in traffic after the launch of the application, as more users became aware of the platform and began using it.

## V. Conclusion

In conclusion, building the web application for selling and buying vehicle parts presented some challenges, including the need to adapt to a right-to-left layout and Hebrew language.
However, by researching best practices and carefully aligning all of the elements on the page, I was able to successfully overcome these challenges and deliver a high-quality application that met the needs of the users. 

The results of the project speak for themselves, with increased user engagement, improved user experience, and increased website traffic. In the future, I will consider these lessons learned and apply them to similar projects to ensure their success.
